  Hello ,people 

I just started to use Junit.I like this.

But, When I am writing a test code , i am wondering 
how many test classes to one target class.

Suppose that I have a target class named as SamuraiDAO,
and it has 10 public methods to be tested 
and each method has 15 test cases.

then it makes that the tese class named of SamuraiDAOTest 
has 150 test methods !!! its not easy to maintain test code,
because I wrote many comments about test case details as well.

So , i am thinking about splitting the test class SamuraiDAOTest 
to liek SamuraiDAO4methodMediationTest and 
SamuraiDAO4meditatemethodTest ,SamuraiDAO4fightmethodTest and so on. 

BUt, Im not sure that is good idea or not.
Is this a bad practice to split?
Target classs and Test Case class should be 1 to 1 ?

Thanks,

Masashi Nakane
